original_body_lines: If your face is really dry and in need of some quenching, so you can have that dewy glowing look that’s on-trend right now, then go grab that aloe plant out of the kitchen and put it to use… in a different way.
To have that fresh, nourished skin, all you need is honey (one tablespoon raw honey) and three inches of an aloe vera.
Slice the aloe leaf open, lengthwise, and use a spoon to scrape all the juicy goodness from the inside.
Mix the aloe vera juice, with the honey, in the palm of your hand, or in a small bowl.
Using the back of a spoon, and gently apply the mixture, in a thin coat, over the entire face and neck.
Relax for at least 15 minutes, allowing the mask to quench your skin.
In a bowl, mix the raw honey and virgin unrefined coconut oil
If the mixture is too watery, you can put it in the fridge for 5 to 10 minutes, so it thickens.
Once it is slightly hardened, remove it from the fridge and whip it again.
After cleaning your skin, apply your honey and coconut oil face mask to your face, using your fingers, in small circular motions.
You can let the washcloth sit on your face for 10-20 seconds, and then gently wipe away the mask.
